en: The tune had been haunting London for weeks past. It was one of countless similar songs published for the benefit of the proles by a sub-section of the Music Department. The words of these songs were composed without any human intervention whatever on an instrument known as a versificator. But the woman sang so tunefully as to turn the dreadful rubbish into an almost pleasant sound. He could hear the woman singing and the scrape of her shoes on the flagstones, and the cries of the children in the street, and somewhere in the far distance a faint roar of traffic, and yet the room seemed curiously silent, thanks to the absence of a telescreen.
vi: Mấy tuần gần đây khắp London, đi đâu cũng nghe thấy bài này. Đấy là một trong rất nhiều bài hát dành cho cu li do Ban Âm Nhạc sáng tác. Lời những bài hát loại này được một cái máy có tên là “Thi sĩ” viết, không cần bàn tay con người can thiệp. Nhưng giọng người đàn bà du dương đến nỗi dù bài hát nhảm nhí nghe vẫn êm tai. Anh nghe thấy tiếng hát, nghe thấy tiếng giày loẹt xoẹt trên mặt đá, tiếng trẻ con hò hét trên đường phố, tiếng động cơ ô tô từ xa vẳng lại, nhưng căn phòng thì vẫn yên tĩnh lạ lùng, ấy là do không có màn vô tuyến.
tr: Bu ezgi birkaç haftadır Londra'nın dilinden düşmüyordu. Müzik Bölümünün bir şubesi tarafından, proleterler için hazırlanan ve hepsi de birbirinin aynı olan bir yığın şarkıdan bir tanesiydi bu. Şarkının sözleri, insan eli değmeksizin, güftekâr adı verilen bir makine tarafından yazılıyordu. Ama kadının söyle- yişi şarkıyı güzelleştirmişti, sanki! Kadının şarkısını, ayakkabılarının taşlarda çıkardığı sesi, sokaktaki çocukların bağırışlarını, uzaklardaki trafik uğultusunu duymasına karşın, oda sessizmiş gibiydi: Çünkü odada tele ekran yoktu.
es: Esta canción obsesionaba a Londres desde hacía muchas semanas. Era una de las producciones de una subsección del Departamento de Música con destino a los proles. La letra de estas canciones se componía sin intervención humana en absoluto, valiéndose de un instrumento llamado «versificador». Pero la mujer la cantaba con tan buen oído que el horrible sonsonete se había convertido en unos sonidos casi agradables. Winston oía la voz de la mujer, el ruido de sus zapatos sobre el empedrado del patio, los gritos de los niños en la calle, y a cierta distancia, muy débilmente, el zumbido del tráfico, y sin embargo su habitación parecía impresionantemente silenciosa gracias a la ausencia de telepantalla.
vi_translation: In recent weeks all over London, wherever you go, you hear this song. It is one of many songs for the laborers composed by the Music Committee. The lyrics of these kinds of songs are written by a machine called the "Poet," without any human intervention. But the woman's voice is so melodious that even though the song is nonsensical, it still sounds pleasant. He heard the singing, the sound of shoes scuffling on the stone, the children shouting in the streets, the distant hum of car engines, but the room was strangely quiet, as there was no television screen.
tr_translation: This melody had been on everyone's lips in London for a few weeks. It was one of a heap of songs, all identical to each other, prepared for the proletarians by a branch of the Music Department. The lyrics of the song were written by a machine called a versificator, without any human intervention. But the woman's singing- It was as if the song had been beautified! Despite hearing the woman's song, the sound of her shoes on the stones, the shouts of children in the street, and the hum of distant traffic, the room seemed quiet: Because there was no telescreen in the room.
es_translation: This song had been obsessing London for many weeks. It was one of the productions of a subsection of the Music Department intended for the proles. The lyrics of these songs were composed without any human intervention at all, using an instrument called a "versificator." But the woman sang it with such a good ear that the horrible jingle had turned into almost pleasant sounds. Winston heard the woman's voice, the noise of her shoes on the cobblestones of the courtyard, the children's shouts in the street, and at a certain distance, very faintly, the hum of traffic, and yet his room seemed impressively silent thanks to the absence of a telescreen.

en: “Real sugar? Not saccharine, sugar. And here’s a loaf of bread—proper white bread, not our bloody stuff—and a little pot of jam. And here’s a tin of milk—but look! This is the one I’m really proud of. I had to wrap a bit of sacking round it, because—”
vi: "Đường thật. Không phải đường hoá học đâu. Còn đây là bánh mì, bánh mì trắng hẳn hoi nhá, không phải loại tởm lợm ta vẫn ăn đâu... đây là lọ mứt, còn đây là lon sữa bò, nhìn này! Thấy em giỏi không! Em phải lấy giấy gói xi măng bọc bên ngoài vì..."
tr: "Gerçek şeker elbette. Sakarin değil. İşte bu da bir somun ekmek, beyaz cinsten, o korkunç siyah şeyden değil, bir kavanoz da reçel. Bir şişe de süt. Ama asıl övüncüm bu. Etrafını bezle sarmak zorunda kaldım, çünkü...
es: —Azúcar de verdad. No sacarina, sino verdadero azúcar. Y aquí tienes un magnífico pan blanco, no esas porquerías que nos dan, y un bote de mermelada. Y aquí tienes un bote de leche condensada. Pero fíjate en esto; estoy orgullosísima de haberlo conseguido. Tuve que envolverlo con tela de saco para que no se conociera, porque...
vi_translation: "Real sugar. Not artificial sweetener. And here is bread, real white bread, not the disgusting kind we usually eat... here is a jar of jam, and here is a can of condensed milk, look! See how good I am! I had to wrap it in cement paper because..."
tr_translation: "Real sugar, of course. Not saccharin. Here is a loaf of bread, the white kind, not that dreadful black stuff, and a jar of jam. A bottle of milk, too. But this is my real pride. I had to wrap it with cloth, because..."
es_translation: —Real sugar. Not saccharin, but real sugar. And here you have a magnificent white bread, not those disgusting things they give us, and a jar of jam. And here you have a can of condensed milk. But look at this; I am very proud to have gotten it. I had to wrap it with sackcloth so it wouldn't be recognized, because...

en: “No, I never knew them. They were Inner Party members. Besides, they were far older men than I was. They belonged to the old days, before the Revolution. I barely knew them by sight.”
vi: "Không, anh có quen biết gì họ đâu. Họ là đảng viên Đảng Nội Bộ. Họ già hơn anh nhiều. Họ thuộc thế hệ cũ, trước Cách Mạng. Thậm chí mặt họ anh cũng chỉ biết sơ sơ thôi"
tr: "Hayır, onları tanımıyordum. İç Parti üyeleriydiler. Üstelik benden çok yaşlıydılar. Devrimden önceki günlerin adamlarıydılar. Kendilerini bir kez uzaktan görmüştüm, o kadar.
es: —No, no los conocía personalmente. Eran miembros del Partido Interior. Además, eran mucho mayores que yo. Conocieron la época anterior a la Revolución. Yo sólo los conocía de vista.
vi_translation: "No, I don't know them at all." "They are members of the Internal Party. They are much older than me." "They belong to the old generation, before the Revolution." "I only vaguely know their faces."
tr_translation: "No, I didn't know them. They were Inner Party members. Moreover, they were much older than me. They were men from the days before the Revolution. I had seen them once from a distance, that's all."
es_translation: —No, I didn't know them personally. They were members of the Inner Party. Besides, they were much older than me. They knew the time before the Revolution. I only knew them by sight.

en: “What I had really intended to say was that in your article I noticed you had used two words which have become obsolete. But they have only become so very recently. Have you seen the tenth edition of the Newspeak dictionary?”
vi: "Tôi muốn nói, trong bài báo của anh tôi đã phát hiện được hai từ được coi là đã cũ. Hai từ này mới bị coi là cũ gần đây thôi. Anh đã thấy cuốn từ điển Ngômo in lần thứ mười chưa?"
tr: "Söylemek istediğim şuydu aslında, makalenizde kullanımdan kalkmış iki sözcük kullanmışsınız. Ama değişiklik çok yakın zaman önce oldu. Yenikonuş sözlüğünün onuncu baskısını gördünüz mü?
es: —Lo que quise decir fue que noté en tu artículo que habías empleado dos palabras ya anticuadas. En realidad, hace muy poco tiempo que se han quedado anticuadas. ¿Has visto la décima edición del Diccionario de Neolengua?
vi_translation: "I mean, in your article, I discovered two words that are considered old. These two words have only recently been considered old. Have you seen the tenth edition of the Ngomo dictionary?"
tr_translation: "What I actually meant to say is that you used two obsolete words in your article. But the change happened very recently. Have you seen the tenth edition of the Newspeak dictionary?"
es_translation: —What I meant to say was that I noticed in your article that you had used two words that are already outdated. In fact, they have only recently become outdated. Have you seen the tenth edition of the Newspeak Dictionary?

en: “The tenth edition is not due to appear for some months, I believe. But a few advance copies have been circulated. I have one myself. It might interest you to look at it, perhaps?”
vi: "Theo tôi biết thì phải mấy tháng nữa mới phát hành lần in thứ mười. Nhưng đã lưu hành mấy bản in thử rồi. Tôi cũng có một bản. Anh có thích xem không?"
tr: "Onuncu baskı birkaç ay sonra çıkacak, sanırım. Ama kısıtlı bir miktarda dağıtıldı. Bende bir tane var. Bakmak ister miydiniz?
es: Bueno, la décima edición tardará varios meses en aparecer, pero ya han circulado algunos ejemplares en pruebas. Yo tengo uno. Quizás te interese verlo, ¿no?
vi_translation: "As far as I know, it will be a few more months before the tenth edition is released. But a few trial prints have already been circulated. I also have a copy. Would you like to see it?"
tr_translation: "The tenth edition will be released in a few months, I think. But it was distributed in a limited quantity. I have one. Would you like to take a look?"
es_translation: Well, the tenth edition will take several months to appear, but some test copies have already circulated. I have one. Maybe you're interested in seeing it, right?

en: In the dream he had remembered his last glimpse of his mother, and within a few moments of waking the cluster of small events surrounding it had all come back. It was a memory that he must have deliberately pushed out of his consciousness over many years. He was not certain of the date, but he could not have been less than ten years old, possibly twelve, when it had happened.
vi: Trong mơ anh nhớ đã trông thấy mẹ lần cuối và ngay sau khi thức giấc tất cả các sự kiện ngày hôm đó lần lượt hiện về trong trí não. Chắc là nhiều năm qua anh đã cố tình gạt khỏi tâm trí đoạn hồi ức này. Anh không biết chính xác khi nào, nhưng ít nhất lúc đó anh đã lên mười, có thể mười hai.
tr: En azından fiilen." Düşünde annesinin onu son gördüğü biçimiyle canlanması başka anıları da çağrıştırdı. Yıllar boyunca belleğinden kovmuş olduğu bir anıydı bu. Tarihi tam olarak hatırlamıyordu, ama olay yer aldığından en azından on, hatta on iki yaşında olmalıydı.
es: En el ensueño había recordado su última visión de la madre y, pocos instantes después de despertar, le había vuelto el racimo de pequeños acontecimientos que rodearon aquel hecho. Sin duda, había estado reprimiendo deliberadamente aquel recuerdo durante muchos años. No estaba seguro de la fecha, pero debió de ser hacía menos de diez años o, a lo mas, doce.
vi_translation: In his dream, he remembered seeing his mother for the last time, and right after waking up, all the events of that day came back to his mind one by one. He must have deliberately tried to push this memory out of his mind for many years. He didn't know exactly when, but at least at that time he was ten, maybe twelve.
tr_translation: The way his mother appeared in his dream as she last saw him triggered other memories. This was a memory he had banished from his mind for years. He couldn't remember the exact date, but he must have been at least ten, maybe even twelve years old when the event took place.
es_translation: In the dream, he had remembered his last vision of his mother and, a few moments after waking, the cluster of small events surrounding that moment had come back to him. Undoubtedly, he had been deliberately repressing that memory for many years. He wasn't sure of the date, but it must have been less than ten years ago or, at most, twelve.

en: The dream was still vivid in his mind, especially the enveloping protecting gesture of the arm in which its whole meaning seemed to be contained. His mind went back to another dream of two months ago. Exactly as his mother had sat on the dingy white-quilted bed, with the child clinging to her, so she had sat in the sunken ship, far underneath him and drowning deeper every minute, but still looking up at him through the darkening water.
vi: Giấc mơ vẫn còn đọng lại một cách sống động trong tâm trí, đặc biệt là hình ảnh cánh tay bảo bọc, che chắn của mẹ; có thể ý nghĩa của giấc mơ nằm ở đó. Anh chợt nhớ một giấc mơ khác, xảy ra cách đó hai tháng. Trong giấc mơ hôm nay mẹ ngồi trên cái giường bẩn thỉu, lót vải trắng, tay ôm em bé, thì lần đó mẹ ngồi trên một con tầu đang chìm dần, rất sâu bên dưới, mỗi lúc lại chìm xuống sâu hơn, nhưng vẫn nhìn anh qua làn nước đen.
tr: Düşü, belleğinde capcanlıydı hâlâ; özellikle tüm anlamı içinde taşıyan o sarılma hareketi aklından çıkmıyordu. Düşünceleri iki ay önce görmüş olduğu bir başka düşe kaydı. Annesi- nin, kollarında kızkardeşi, tıpkı beyaz yatakta oturduğu zamanki gibi sürekli derinlere doğru battığı, karanlık sulara gömülürken o geminin içinden yukarıya, ona doğru baktığı o düş...
es: El ensueño seguía vivo en su mente, sobre todo el gesto protector de la madre, que parecía contener un profundo significado. Entonces recordó otro ensueño que había tenido dos meses antes, cuando se le había aparecido hundiéndose sin cesar en aquel barco, pero sin dejar de mirarlo a él a través del agua que se oscurecía por momentos.
vi_translation: The dream still lingers vividly in the mind, especially the image of the protective, shielding arms of the mother; perhaps the meaning of the dream lies there. He suddenly remembered another dream, which happened two months ago. In today's dream, the mother was sitting on a dirty bed, lined with white cloth, holding a baby in her arms, while in that previous dream, she was sitting on a sinking ship, very deep below, sinking deeper each moment, but still looking at him through the dark water.
tr_translation: The dream was still vivid in his memory; especially that embrace, which carried all the meaning, wouldn't leave his mind. His thoughts drifted to another dream he had seen two months ago. His mother- the dream where, with his sister in his arms, he was sinking deeper and deeper into the dark waters, just like when she sat on the white bed, while looking up at him from inside that ship...
es_translation: The daydream remained alive in his mind, especially the protective gesture of the mother, which seemed to hold a deep meaning. Then he remembered another daydream he had had two months earlier, when she had appeared to him, sinking endlessly in that ship, but never stopping to look at him through the water that was darkening by the moment.

en: He thought of the telescreen with its never-sleeping ear. They could spy upon you night and day, but if you kept your head you could still outwit them. With all their cleverness they had never mastered the secret of finding out what another human being was thinking. Perhaps that was less true when you were actually in their hands. One did not know what happened inside the Ministry of Love, but it was possible to guess: tortures, drugs, delicate instruments that registered your nervous reactions, gradual wearing-down by sleeplessness and solitude and persistent questioning. Facts, at any rate, could not be kept hidden. They could be tracked down by inquiry, they could be squeezed out of you by torture. But if the object was not to stay alive but to stay human, what difference did it ultimately make? They could not alter your feelings; for that matter you could not alter them yourself, even if you wanted to. They could lay bare in the utmost detail everything that you had done or said or thought; but the inner heart, whose workings were mysterious even to yourself, remained impregnable.
vi: Anh nghĩ đến cái màn vô tuyến với bộ phận thu thanh thường trực hai bốn trên hai bốn giờ mỗi ngày. Chúng có thể theo dõi suốt ngày đêm, nhưng nếu tỉnh giác ta vẫn có thể lừa được chúng. Dù khôn khéo đến đâu chúng cũng không thể nào biết được ta đang nghĩ gì. Rơi vào tay chúng rồi thì lại là chuyện khác. Không ai biết người ta làm gì trong Bộ Tình Yêu, chỉ có thể đoán: tra tấn, thuốc phiện, các dụng cụ tinh vi có thể ghi được phản ứng của hệ thần kinh, làm cho kiệt sức vì mất ngủ, cô đơn và bị hỏi cung liên tục. Các sự kiện thì không thể nào dấu được rồi. Chúng sẽ lần ra bằng cách hỏi cung, chúng sẽ tra tấn cho bằng đượ mới thôi. Nhưng nếu mục đích không phải là sống mà là tiếp tục làm người thì lại khác, chúng làm gì được ta? Chúng không thể thay đổi được tình cảm của ta, ta còn không thay đổi được tình cảm của mình nữa là chúng. Chúng có thể lôi ra tất cả mọi thứ, chúng có thể biết tường tận ta đã làm gì, nói gì, nghĩ gì, nhưng tâm hồn ta, cơ chế hoạt động của nó là một điều bí ẩn đối với chính ta, sẽ không kẻ nào xâm nhập vào được. [1]Ounce – Đơn vị đo trọng lượng, bằng 28,35 gram.
tr: Tele ekranın hiç uyumayan kulaklarını düşündü. Gece gündüz insanı gözetleseler de, soğukkanlılığını koruduğun sürece onları yenebilirsin. Tüm kurnazlıklarına karşın, insan kafasından geçenleri okuma sırrını çözemediler. Bu sav ellerine düştüğünüzde geçerli olmuyordu, belki. Kimse Sevgi Bakanlığında ne olup bittiğini bilmezdi, ama tahmin edebilirdi; işkenceler, ilaçlar, tepkilerinizi ölçen duyarlı aygıtlar, uykusuzluk, yalnızlık ve sürekli sorgulamadan yorgun düşen bedenler. En azından, somut gerçekleri gizleyemezdiniz. Bunları araştırarak bulurlar, işkenceyle sizden sökerlerdi. Ama amaç yaşamak değil, insan kalmaksa, bunun ne önemi olabilirdi? Duygularınızı değiştiremezlerdi; siz kendiniz bile, isteseniz değiştiremezdiniz onları. Yaptığınız, söylediğiniz ya da düşündüğünüz her şeyi en ince ayrıntısına dek ortaya çıkarabilirler, ama gönlünüzün derinliğine, işleyişini sizin bile bilmediğiniz o yere el uzatamazlar-dı.
es: Y pensó en la telepantalla, que nunca dormía, que nunca se distraía ni dejaba de oír. Podían espiarle a uno día y noche, pero no perdiendo la cabeza era posible burlarlos. Con toda su habilidad, nunca habían logrado encontrar el procedimiento de saber lo que pensaba otro ser humano. Quizás esto fuera menos cierto cuando le tenían a uno en sus manos. No se sabía lo que pasaba dentro del Ministerio del Amor, pero era fácil figurárselo: torturas, drogas, delicados instrumentos que registraban las reacciones nerviosas, agotamiento progresivo por la falta de sueño, por la soledad y los interrogatorios implacables y persistentes. Los hechos no podían ser ocultados, se los exprimían a uno con la tortura o les seguían la pista con los interrogatorios. Pero si la finalidad que uno se proponía no era salvar la vida sino haber sido humanos hasta el final, ¿qué importaba todo aquello? Los sentimientos no podían cambiarlos; es más, ni uno mismo podría suprimirlos. Sin duda, podrían saber hasta el más pequeño detalle de todo lo que uno hubiera hecho, dicho o pensado; pero el fondo del corazón, cuyo contenido era un misterio incluso para su dueño, se mantendría siempre inexpugnable.
vi_translation: He thought about the screen with the radio receiver that was on twenty-four hours a day. They could monitor day and night, but if one was alert, they could still be deceived. No matter how clever they were, they could never know what one was thinking. Falling into their hands was a different story. No one knew what happened in the Ministry of Love, only guesses: torture, drugs, sophisticated devices that could record nervous system reactions, exhaustion from sleep deprivation, loneliness, and continuous interrogation. Facts could not be hidden. They would find out through interrogation, they would torture until they succeeded. But if the goal was not to live but to remain human, it was different; what could they do to us? They could not change our feelings; if we couldn't change our own feelings, how could they? They could extract everything, they could know in detail what we did, said, and thought, but our soul, its workings were a mystery even to ourselves, and no one could penetrate it. [1]Ounce – Unit of weight measurement, equal to 28.35 grams.
tr_translation: He thought about the ever-awake ears of the telescreen. Even if they watched you day and night, as long as you kept your composure, you could defeat them. Despite all their cunning, they couldn't solve the secret of reading what goes on in a human's mind. Perhaps this wasn't valid when you fell into their hands. No one knew what happened in the Ministry of Love, but they could guess; tortures, drugs, sensitive devices measuring your reactions, sleeplessness, loneliness, and bodies exhausted from constant interrogation. At the very least, you couldn't hide concrete facts. They would find these out by investigating, they would extract them from you through torture. But if the goal was not to live, but to remain human, what importance could that have? They couldn't change your feelings; even you yourself couldn't change them, even if you wanted to. They could reveal everything you did, said, or thought in the finest detail, but they couldn't reach that deep place in your heart, the place whose workings even you didn't know.
es_translation: And he thought about the telescreen, which never slept, which never got distracted nor stopped listening. They could spy on someone day and night, but by not losing one's head, it was possible to outsmart them. With all their skill, they had never managed to find a way to know what another human being was thinking. Perhaps this was less true when they had someone in their hands. No one knew what happened inside the Ministry of Love, but it was easy to imagine: tortures, drugs, delicate instruments that recorded nervous reactions, progressive exhaustion from lack of sleep, from solitude, and from relentless and persistent interrogations. The facts could not be hidden; they were squeezed out of someone with torture or tracked down with interrogations. But if the goal one set was not to save one's life but to have been human until the end, what did all that matter? Feelings could not be changed; moreover, not even oneself could suppress them. Without a doubt, they could know even the smallest detail of everything someone had done, said, or thought; but the depths of the heart, whose content was a mystery even to its owner, would always remain impregnable.

en: “You are prepared to cheat, to forge, to blackmail, to corrupt the minds of children, to distribute habit-forming drugs, to encourage prostitution, to disseminate venereal diseases—to do anything which is likely to cause demoralization and weaken the power of the Party?”
vi: "Sẵn sàng lừa bịp, làm tài liệu giả, tống tiền, mua chuộc trẻ con, reo rắc các chất ma tuý, thúc đẩy nạn mại dâm, reo rắc các bệnh hoa liễu, nghĩa là làm tất cả nhằm làm băng hoại đạo đức xã hội và phá hoại Đảng?" "Sẵn sàng."
tr: "Dolandırıcılık, düzenbazlık, şantaj yapmaya, çocukların zihinlerini bozmaya, alışkanlık doğuran ilaçlar dağıtmaya, fu-huşu özendirmeye, zührevi hastalıkların yayılmasına çalışmaya, halkın moralinin bozulmasına ve Partinin gücünün azalmasına neden olacak her şeyi yapmaya hazır mısınız?
es: —¿Estáis dispuestos a hacer trampas, a falsificar, a hacer chantaje, a corromper a los niños, a distribuir drogas, a fomentar la prostitución, a extender enfermedades venéreas... a hacer todo lo que pueda causar desmoralización y debilitar el poder del Partido?
vi_translation: "Ready to deceive, forge documents, blackmail, bribe children, spread drugs, promote prostitution, spread venereal diseases, in other words, do everything to corrupt social morals and destroy the Party?"
tr_translation: "Are you ready to do everything that will lead to fraud, deceit, blackmail, corrupting children's minds, distributing habit-forming drugs, promoting prostitution, spreading venereal diseases, demoralizing the public, and weakening the Party's power?"
es_translation: —Are you willing to cheat, to falsify, to blackmail, to corrupt children, to distribute drugs, to promote prostitution, to spread venereal diseases... to do everything that can cause demoralization and weaken the power of the Party?

en: To understand the nature of the present war—for in spite of the regrouping which occurs every few years, it is always the same war—one must realize in the first place that it is impossible for it to be decisive. None of the three superstates could be definitively conquered even by the other two in combination. They are too evenly matched, and their natural defenses are too formidable. Eurasia is protected by its vast land spaces. Oceania by the width of the Atlantic and the Pacific, Eastasia by the fecundity and industriousness of its inhabitants. Secondly, there is no longer, in a material sense, anything to fight about. With the establishment of self-contained economies, in which production and consumption are geared to one another, the scramble for markets which was a main cause of previous wars has come to an end, while the competition for raw materials is no longer a matter of life and death. In any case, each of the three superstates is so vast that it can obtain almost all the materials that it needs within its own boundaries. In so far as the war has a direct economic purpose, it is a war for labor power. Between the frontiers of the superstates, and not permanently in the possession of any of them, there lies a rough quadrilateral with its corners at Tangier, Brazzaville, Darwin, and Hong Kong, containing within it about a fifth of the population of the earth. It is for the possession of these thickly populated regions, and of the northern ice cap, that the three powers are constantly struggling. In practice no one power ever controls the whole of the disputed area. Portions of it are constantly changing hands, and it is the chance of seizing this or that fragment by a sudden stroke of treachery that dictates the endless changes of alignment.
vi: Để có thể hiểu bản chất của cuộc chiến tranh hiện nay - dù bạn thù thay đổi vài năm một lần, nó vẫn là một cuộc chiến mà thôi - ta phải luôn nhớ rằng cuộc chiến này không có hồi kết. Dù quân đội hai nước có hợp lại cũng không thể đánh bại được nước thứ ba. Sức lực của họ gần tương đương nhau, khả năng phòng thủ tự nhiên lại vô cùng vững chắc. Eurasia được bao bọc bởi những vùng đất vô cùng rộng lớn, Oceania thì được Đại Tây Dương và Thái Bình Dương bảo vệ, còn Eastasia thì có dân số vô cùng đông đúc và chăm chỉ. Thứ hai, họ không đánh nhau để tranh giành quyền lợi vật chất. Với việc thiết lập các nền kinh tế tự cung tự cấp, trong đó sản xuất và tiêu thụ được điều chỉnh cho phù hợp với nhau, tranh giành thị trường, lí do chính của các cuộc chiến trước, nay đã trở nên không còn cần thiết nữa; trong khi đó nguyên vật liệu cũng không phải là vấn đề sống còn. Cả ba nước đều rộng đến nỗi có thể khai thác tất cả các nguyên vật liệu cần thiết ngay trong vùng lãnh thổ của mình. Nếu nói về mục đích kinh tế trực tiếp thì đây là cuộc chiến tranh để giành lực lượng lao động. Giữa biên giới của các siêu cường là một vùng tứ giác với các đỉnh nằm ở Tangier, Brazzaville, Darwin và Hong Kong, vùng này không thuộc hẳn siêu cường nào, lại có đến một phần năm dân số thế giới. Tranh giành vùng đất đông dân này và vùng băng giá bắc bán cầu là lí do dẫn đến những cuộc tranh chấp thường xuyên giữa các siêu cường. Chưa nước nào chiếm trọn được vùng nằm trong vòng tranh cãi. Từng phần của nó được sang tay thường xuyên, để có thể giành được một vùng nào đó người ta sẵn sàng phản bội đồng minh, biến bạn thành thù và đấy là lí do của những vụ thay đổi liên minh bất tận.
tr: Şu andaki savaşın yapısını anlayabilmek için -birkaç yılda bir yeni kümeler oluşturulmasına karşın, savaş gene de aynı savaştır- ilk olarak, bunun kesinliğinin olanaksız olduğu unutulmamalıdır. Üç süper dev- letten ikisi birleşseler bile, ötekini bir yenilgiye uğralamazlar. Kuvvet açısından eşittirler ve doğal savunmaları güç kırılabilir. Avrasya uçsuz bucaksız topraklarına, Okyanusya Pasifik ve Atlantik'in genişliğine, Doğu Asya da, nüfusunun hızla çoğalmasına ve çalışkanlığına güvenir. İkinci olarak, savaşlar sonucunda elde edilecek maddi bir kazanç yoktur. Kendine yeterli ekonomilerin kurulmasıyla, daha önceki savaşların temel nedenini oluşturan pazarlar için savaşım sona ermiş bulunmaktadır. Her üç devlet de gereksinimlerini kendi sınırları içinde karşılayabildiği için, hammadde sorunu önemini yitirmiştir. Eğer savaş, ekonomik bir amaç taşıyorsa, o da iş gücüdür. Tanca, Brazzaville, Darwin ve Hong Kong arasında dünya nüfusunun beşte birini içeren ve üç büyük devletin de ele geçirmek için uğraştığı topraklar uzanmaktadır. Hiçbir devlet tekbaşına buraları denetim altına alamamıştır. Alanın değişik bölümleri sürekli el değiştirmektedir, sonu gelmeyen müttefik değiştirmelerin de nedeni burada yatmaktadır.
es: Para comprender la naturaleza de la guerra actual —pues, a pesar del reagrupamiento que ocurre cada pocos años, siempre es la misma guerra— hay que darse cuenta en primer lugar de que esa guerra no puede ser decisiva. Ninguno de los tres superestados podría ser conquistado definitivamente ni siquiera por los otros dos en combinación. Sus fuerzas están demasiado bien equilibradas. Y sus defensas son demasiado poderosas. Eurasia está protegida por sus grandes espacios terrestres, Oceanía por la anchura del Atlántico y del Pacífico, Asia Oriental por la fecundidad y laboriosidad de sus habitantes. Además, ya no hay nada por qué luchar. Con las economías autárquicas, la lucha por los mercados, que era una de las causas principales de las guerras anteriores, ha dejado de tener sentido, y la competencia por las materias primas ya no es una cuestión de vida o muerte. Cada uno de los tres superestados es tan inmenso que puede obtener casi todas las materias que necesita dentro de sus propias fronteras. Si acaso, se propone la guerra el dominio del trabajo. Entre las fronteras de los superestados, y sin pertenecer de un modo permanente a ninguno de ellos, se extiende un cuadrilátero, con sus ángulos en Tánger, Brazzaville, Darwin y Hong-Kong, que contiene casi una quinta parte de la población de la Tierra. Las tres potencias luchan constantemente por la posesión de estas regiones densamente pobladas, así como por las zonas polares. En la práctica, ningún poder controla totalmente esa área disputada. Porciones de ella están cambiando a cada momento de manos, y lo que en realidad determina los súbitos y múltiples cambios de alianzas es la posibilidad de apoderarse de uno u otro pedazo de tierra mediante una inesperada traición.
vi_translation: To understand the nature of the current war - even though allies and enemies change every few years, it remains a war - we must always remember that this war has no end. Even if the armies of two countries join forces, they cannot defeat the third country. Their strengths are nearly equivalent, and their natural defenses are extremely solid. Eurasia is surrounded by vast lands, Oceania is protected by the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans, and Eastasia has a very large and diligent population. Secondly, they do not fight for material benefits. With the establishment of self-sufficient economies, where production and consumption are adjusted to match each other, the competition for markets, the main reason for previous wars, has become unnecessary; meanwhile, raw materials are not a critical issue. All three countries are so large that they can exploit all the necessary raw materials within their own territories. In terms of direct economic purpose, this is a war to gain labor forces. Between the borders of the superpowers lies a quadrilateral region with vertices at Tangier, Brazzaville, Darwin, and Hong Kong, a region that does not wholly belong to any superpower, yet contains one-fifth of the world's population. The competition for this densely populated area and the icy regions of the northern hemisphere is the reason for the frequent disputes between the superpowers. No country has fully occupied the contested region. Parts of it frequently change hands, and to gain control of a particular area, people are willing to betray allies, turn friends into enemies, and this is the reason for the endless changes in alliances.
tr_translation: To understand the structure of the current war - despite the formation of new clusters every few years, the war is still the same war - it must first be remembered that its certainty is impossible. The three superpowers- Even if two of them unite, they cannot defeat the other. They are equal in terms of strength, and their natural defenses are hard to break. Eurasia relies on its vast lands, Oceania on the expanse of the Pacific and Atlantic, and East Asia on its rapidly growing population and industriousness. Secondly, there is no material gain to be obtained as a result of wars. With the establishment of self-sufficient economies, the struggle for markets, which was the main cause of previous wars, has come to an end. Since all three states can meet their needs within their own borders, the issue of raw materials has lost its importance. If war has an economic purpose, it is labor. Between Tangier, Brazzaville, Darwin, and Hong Kong lie lands containing one-fifth of the world's population, which all three major states strive to capture. No state has been able to control these areas alone. The different parts of the area are constantly changing hands, and this is the reason for the endless shifts in alliances.
es_translation: To understand the nature of the current war —for, despite the regrouping that occurs every few years, it is always the same war— one must first realize that this war cannot be decisive. None of the three superstates could be definitively conquered, not even by the other two in combination. Their forces are too well balanced. And their defenses are too powerful. Eurasia is protected by its vast land spaces, Oceania by the width of the Atlantic and the Pacific, East Asia by the fertility and industriousness of its inhabitants. Moreover, there is no longer anything to fight for. With autarkic economies, the struggle for markets, which was one of the main causes of previous wars, has ceased to make sense, and competition for raw materials is no longer a matter of life and death. Each of the three superstates is so immense that it can obtain almost all the materials it needs within its own borders. If anything, the war aims at the domination of labor. Between the borders of the superstates, and without permanently belonging to any of them, there extends a quadrilateral, with its corners in Tangier, Brazzaville, Darwin, and Hong Kong, which contains almost one-fifth of the Earth's population. The three powers constantly fight for the possession of these densely populated regions, as well as for the polar zones. In practice, no power totally controls this disputed area. Portions of it are constantly changing hands, and what actually determines the sudden and multiple changes of alliances is the possibility of seizing one or another piece of land through an unexpected betrayal.

en: He had still, he reflected, not learned the ultimate secret. He understood how; he did not understand why. Chapter 1, like Chapter 3, had not actually told him anything that he did not know; it had merely systematized the knowledge that he possessed already. But after reading it he knew better than before that he was not mad. Being in a minority, even a minority of one, did not make you mad. There was truth and there was untruth, and if you clung to the truth even against the whole world, you were not mad. A yellow beam from the sinking sun slanted in through the window and fell across the pillow. He shut his eyes. The sun on his face and the girl’s smooth body touching his own gave him a strong, sleepy, confident feeling. He was safe, everything was all right. He fell asleep murmuring “Sanity is not statistical,” with the feeling that this remark contained in it a profound wisdom.
vi: Anh nằm yên, tiếp tục suy nghĩ, thế là anh vẫn chưa biết được cái bí mật quan trọng nhất. Anh hiểu làm thế nào, nhưng không hiểu tại sao. Chương I và chương III không có gì mới, nó chỉ hệ thống lại những kiến thức mà anh đã biết. Nhưng sau khi đọc xong thì anh biết một cách chắc chắn rằng mình không điên. Thiểu số, ngay cả rút lại chỉ còn một người cũng không có nghĩa là điên. Thật và giả luôn luôn tồn tại, nếu ta bám chặt vào sự thật, dù cho có phải chống lại cả thế gian thì ta vẫn không phải là một người điên. Một tia nắng vàng chiếu qua cửa sổ và rơi xuống cái gối. Winston nhắm mắt lại. Tia nắng mặt trời âm ấm vờn trên má cùng với những xúc chạm vào da thịt mềm mại của người con gái tạo ra trong anh cảm giác tin tưởng vừa mơ màng, vừa mạnh mẽ. Anh vẫn an toàn, mọi việc vẫn tốt. Anh thiếp đi, miệng lẩm bẩm: "Sáng suốt không phải là số liệu thống kê", thâm tâm thấy như câu đó chứa cả một đạo lí sâu sắc. [1]Nguyên văn: like three sheaves of corn - giống như ba cây ngô. [2]Nguyên văn shortlived – mau chết, chóng tàn.
tr: Henüz en son gizi öğrenememişti. Nasıl olduğunu anlıyordu, ama niçin olduğunu anlamıyordu. Birinci bölüm de, üçün- cüsü gibi, ona yeni bir şey öğretmemiş, yalnızca kendisinde zaten bulunan bilgiyi bir düzene sokmuştu. Ama okuduktan sonra, gerçekten de düşündüklerinin çılgınlık olmadığını anlamıştı. Azınlıkta olmak, bu azınlık tek bir kişiden oluşmuş bile olsa, insanın deli olması demek değildi. Bir yanda doğru, bir yanda yalan vardı ve siz tüm dünyaya karşı olmak pahasına bile, gerçeğe bağlanırsanız, bu size deli niteliğini vermezdi. Batan güneşin altın ışıkları içeri sızmış, yastığın üzerine düşmüştü. Gözlerini yumdu. Yüzüne vuran güneş ve bedenine değen pürüzsüz beden onu güçlü ve güvenli yapıyordu. Biraz uykusu gelmişti. Güven içindeydi ve her şey yolunda gidiyordu. "Akıl istatistiksel değildir," diye mırıldanırken, uyuyakaldı!
es: —Todavía, pensó, no se había enterado de cuál era el último secreto. Entendía el cómo; no entendía el porqué. El capítulo 1, como el capítulo III, no le habían enseñado nada que él no supiera. Solamente le habían servido para sistematizar los conocimientos que ya poseía. Pero después de leer aquellas páginas tenía una mayor seguridad de no estar loco. Encontrarse en minoría, incluso en minoría de uno solo, no significaba estar loco. Había la verdad y lo que no era verdad, y si uno se aferraba a la verdad incluso contra el mundo entero, no estaba uno loco. Un rayo amarillento del sol poniente entraba por la ventana y se aplastaba sobre la almohada. Winston cerró los ojos. El sol en sus ojos y el suave cuerpo de la muchacha tocando al suyo le daba una sensación de sueño, fuerza y confianza. Todo estaba bien y él se hallaba completamente seguro allí. Se durmió con el pensamiento «la cordura no depende de las estadísticas», convencido de que esta observación contenía una sabiduría profunda.
vi_translation: He lay still, continuing to think, thus he still did not know the most important secret. He understood how, but did not understand why. Chapters I and III had nothing new, they only systematized the knowledge he already knew. But after reading, he knew for certain that he was not insane. The minority, even if reduced to just one person, does not mean insanity. Truth and falsehood always exist, if we cling to the truth, even if we have to go against the whole world, we are still not insane. A golden ray of sunlight shone through the window and fell onto the pillow. Winston closed his eyes. The warm sunlight played on his cheek along with the soft touches of the girl's skin, creating in him a feeling of dreamy yet strong trust. He was still safe, everything was still good. He drifted off to sleep, mumbling, "Sanity is not statistical," feeling as if that sentence contained a profound truth. [1]Original text: like three sheaves of corn - like three corn stalks. [2]Original text shortlived – short-lived, fleeting.
tr_translation: He had not yet learned the last secret. He understood how it was, but he didn't understand why it was. The first part, too, the third- Like a cüsü, it didn't teach him anything new, it only organized the knowledge that he already had. But after reading, he realized that what he thought was not madness. Being in the minority, even if that minority consisted of just one person, did not mean that one was mad. There was truth on one side and lies on the other, and if you held on to the truth even at the cost of opposing the whole world, that did not make you mad. The golden rays of the setting sun seeped in and fell on the pillow. He closed his eyes. The sun shining on his face and the smooth body touching his made him feel strong and secure. He felt a bit sleepy. He was safe and everything was going well. "The mind is not statistical," he murmured as he fell asleep!
es_translation: —Still, he thought, he had not yet discovered what the last secret was. He understood the how; he did not understand the why. Chapter 1, like Chapter III, had not taught him anything he didn't already know. They had only served to systematize the knowledge he already possessed. But after reading those pages, he had a greater certainty that he was not crazy. Being in the minority, even a minority of one, did not mean being crazy. There was the truth and what was not the truth, and if one clung to the truth even against the whole world, one was not crazy. A yellowish ray of the setting sun entered through the window and spread across the pillow. Winston closed his eyes. The sun in his eyes and the soft body of the girl touching his gave him a feeling of sleepiness, strength, and confidence. Everything was fine and he felt completely secure there. He fell asleep with the thought "sanity is not statistical," convinced that this observation contained profound wisdom.

en: It was starting, it was starting at last! They could do nothing except stand gazing into one another’s eyes. To run for life, to get out of the house before it was too late—no such thought occurred to them. Unthinkable to disobey the iron voice from the wall. There was a snap as though a catch had been turned back, and a crash of breaking glass. The picture had fallen to the floor, uncovering the telescreen behind it.
vi: Bắt đầu rồi, thế là bắt đầu rồi! Họ cứ đứng yên như thế, người nọ nhìn vào mắt người kia. Chạy trốn, lao ra khỏi nhà trước khi quá muộn - ý nghĩ ấy thậm chí không hề xuất hiện trong đầu cả hai người. Không thể có chuyện chống lại giọng nói phát ra từ cái loa trên tường. Nghe có tiếng như cái then cửa đóng, rồi tiếng kính vỡ. Bức tranh khắc rơi xuống, phía sau nó là màn vô tuyến.
tr: Başlıyordu, sonunda başlıyordu! Birbirlerinin gözlerine bakmaktan başka yapacak bir şey yoktu, o anda. Canlarını kurtarmak için, evden kaçmak için çok geçti artık, böyle bir şeyi akıllarından geçirmediler bile. Duvardan gelen demirden sese düşünmeksizin boyun eğdiler. Bir mandal çevriliyormuş gibi bir tıkırtı oldu, arkasından bir şangırtı koptu. Resim yere düşmüş, arkasındaki tele ekran ortaya çıkmıştı.
es: ¡Por fin, aquello había empezado! Nada podían hacer sino mirarse fijamente. Ni siquiera se les ocurrió escaparse, salir de la casa antes de que fuera demasiado tarde. Sabían que era inútil. Era absurdo pensar que la voz de hierro procedente del muro pudiera ser desobedecida. Se oyó un chasquido como si hubiese girado un resorte, y un ruido de cristal roto. El cuadro había caído al suelo descubriendo la telepantalla que ocultaba.
vi_translation: It has begun, it has begun! They just stood still like that, looking into each other's eyes. Running away, dashing out of the house before it was too late - that thought didn't even cross either of their minds. There was no way to resist the voice coming from the speaker on the wall. There was a sound like a door latch closing, then the sound of glass breaking. The engraved picture fell down, revealing the television screen behind it.
tr_translation: It was starting, finally it was starting! There was nothing to do but look into each other's eyes at that moment. It was too late to save their lives, too late to escape from the house; they didn't even consider such a thing. They submitted to the iron sound coming from the wall without thinking. There was a click as if a latch was being turned, followed by a clatter. The picture had fallen to the ground, revealing the screen behind it.
es_translation: At last, it had begun! They could do nothing but stare at each other intently. It didn't even occur to them to escape, to leave the house before it was too late. They knew it was useless. It was absurd to think that the iron voice coming from the wall could be disobeyed. A click was heard as if a spring had turned, and the sound of breaking glass. The picture had fallen to the floor, revealing the telescreen it had been hiding.

en: “Now we can see you,” said the voice. “Stand out in the middle of the room. Stand back to back. Clasp your hands behind your heads. Do not touch one another.”
vi: “Bây giờ chúng ta sẽ nhìn thấy các người”, giọng nói kia nhắc lại. “Đứng vào giữa phòng. Quay lưng lại với nhau. Tay vòng ra sau gáy. Hai người không được chạm nhau”
tr: Ses, "Artık sizi görebiliyoruz. Odanın ortasına ilerleyin. Sırt sırta durun, ellerinizi başlarınızın arkasında kavuşturun ve birbirinize dokunmayın," dedi.
es: —Ahora podemos veros —dijo la voz—. Permaneced en el centro de la habitación. Espalda contra espalda. Poneos las manos enlazadas detrás de la cabeza. No os toquéis el uno al otro.
vi_translation: "Now we will see you," the voice repeated. "Stand in the middle of the room. Turn your backs to each other. Hands behind your neck. You two must not touch each other."
tr_translation: "We can see you now. Move to the center of the room. Stand back to back, clasp your hands behind your heads, and do not touch each other," he said.
es_translation: —Now we can see you —said the voice—. Remain in the center of the room. Back to back. Put your hands clasped behind your head. Do not touch each other.

en: There was a dull aching in his belly. It had been there ever since they had bundled him into the closed van and driven him away. But he was also hungry, with a gnawing, unwholesome kind of hunger. It might be twenty-four hours since he had eaten, it might be thirty-six. He still did not know, probably never would know, whether it had been morning or evening when they arrested him. Since he was arrested he had not been fed.
vi: Bụng cứ đau âm ỉ suốt. Đau ngay từ lúc anh bị tống vào chiếc xe hòm kín và giải đi. Nhưng anh còn bị đói nữa, đói một cách cồn cào, đói muốn lả người. Bữa cuối cùng cách đây phải cả một ngày, mà cũng có thể một ngày rưỡi rồi. Anh vẫn chưa biết, mà cũng có thể sẽ chẳng bao giờ biết là bị bắt buổi sáng hay buổi chiều. Từ lúc bị bắt đến giờ anh chưa được miếng nào vào bụng.
tr: Karnına uyuşma tarzında bir ağrı yerleşmişti. Kendisini, o kapalı kamyonete atarak, götürdüklerinden beri, devam ediyordu bu ağrı. Midesini kemiren bir açlık duygusu içindeydi; acıkmıştı. Ağzına yemek girmeyeli yirmi dört saat olmuştu, belki de otuz altı saat. Onu tutukladıklarında sabah mı yoksa akşam mı olduğunu hâlâ bilmiyordu, belki de asla öğrenemeyecekti. Kendisine, tutuklandığından bu yana yemek vermemişlerdi.
es: Winston sentía un sordo dolor en el vientre. Le venía doliendo desde que lo encerraron en el camión para llevarlo allí. Pero también tenía hambre, un hambre roedora, anormal. Aunque estaba justificada, porque por lo menos hacía veinticuatro horas que no había comido; quizá treinta y seis. No sabía, quizá nunca lo sabría, si lo habían detenido de día o de noche. Desde que lo detuvieron no le habían dado nada de comer.
vi_translation: The stomach kept aching persistently. The pain started right when he was shoved into the enclosed van and taken away. But he was also hungry, a gnawing hunger, a hunger that made him feel faint. The last meal was probably a whole day ago, or maybe even a day and a half. He still didn't know, and might never know, whether he was captured in the morning or the afternoon. Since being captured, he hadn't had a single bite to eat.
tr_translation: A pain had settled in his abdomen in the form of numbness. Since they had thrown him into that closed van and taken him away, this pain had been continuing. He was in a state of gnawing hunger; he was famished. It had been twenty-four hours, maybe even thirty-six hours, since he had last eaten. He still didn't know whether it was morning or evening when they arrested him, and perhaps he would never know. They hadn't given him any food since his arrest.
es_translation: Winston felt a dull pain in his abdomen. It had been hurting since they locked him in the truck to bring him there. But he was also hungry, with a gnawing, abnormal hunger. Although it was justified, because he hadn't eaten for at least twenty-four hours; maybe thirty-six. He didn't know, and perhaps would never know, whether he had been detained during the day or at night. Since his arrest, they hadn't given him anything to eat.

en: Yes, he saw now, he had always known it. But there was no time to think of that. All he had eyes for was the truncheon in the guard’s hand. It might fall anywhere: on the crown, on the tip of the ear, on the upper arm, on the elbow—
vi: Đúng, đúng là anh đã biết. Nhưng bây giờ không phải là lúc nghĩ tới chuyện đó. Bây giờ trước mắt anh chỉ còn một thứ: cái dùi cui trong tay viên cai ngục. Nó có thể nện vào bất cứ chỗ nào: vào đỉnh đầu, vào mang tai, vào bả vai, vào khuỷu tay...
tr: Evet şimdi görüyordu, her zaman biliyordu. Ama hiçbir zaman düşünecek zamanı olmamıştı. Gözlerini gardiyanın elindeki coptan alamıyordu. Her yerine inebilirdi; kafasına, kulağının ucuna, koluna, dirseğine...
es: Sí, ahora comprendía que siempre lo había sabido. Pero no había tiempo de pensar en ello. Sólo tenía ojos para la porra que se balanceaba en la mano del guardia. El golpe podía caer en cualquier parte de su cuerpo: en la coronilla, encima de la oreja, en el antebrazo, en el codo...
vi_translation: Yes, yes, he did know. But now is not the time to think about that. Now, before his eyes, there was only one thing: the baton in the prison guard's hand. It could strike anywhere: on the top of the head, on the temple, on the shoulder, on the elbow...
tr_translation: Yes, now he saw it, he always knew it. But he never had time to think about it. He couldn't take his eyes off the baton in the guard's hand. It could strike anywhere; his head, the tip of his ear, his arm, his elbow...
es_translation: Yes, now he understood that he had always known it. But there was no time to think about it. He only had eyes for the baton swinging in the guard's hand. The blow could land anywhere on his body: on the crown of his head, above his ear, on his forearm, on his elbow...

en: He was strapped into a chair surrounded by dials, under dazzling lights. A man in a white coat was reading the dials. There was a tramp of heavy boots outside. The door clanged open. The waxen-faced officer marched in, followed by two guards.
vi: Anh bị trói vào một cái ghế, ánh sáng chói chang, xung quanh đủ các loại đồng hồ đo. Một người đàn ông mặc áo choàng trắng đang đọc số liệu trên các đồng hồ đo đó. Có tiếng giầy đinh bước vội vã bên ngoài. Cánh cửa kẹt mở. Người sĩ quan có bộ mặt bằng sáp bước vào, theo sau là hai cai ngục.
tr: Göz kamaştıran ışıklar altında, etrafı çeşitli kadranlarla çevrili bir koltuğa sıkı sıkı bağlanmıştı. Beyaz önlüklü birisi kadranları okuyordu. Dışarıdan sert ayak sesleri geldi; kapı açıldı ve ardında iki gardiyanla soluk yüzlü bir subay içeri girdi.
es: Estaba atado a una silla rodeada de esferas graduadas, bajo cegadores focos. Un hombre con bata blanca leía los discos. Fuera se oía que se acercaban pasos. La puerta se abrió de golpe. El oficial de cara de cera entró seguido por dos guardias.
vi_translation: He was tied to a chair, blinding light, surrounded by all kinds of gauges. A man in a white coat was reading the data on those gauges. There were hurried footsteps of cleated shoes outside. The door creaked open. A wax-faced officer stepped in, followed by two guards.
tr_translation: Under dazzling lights, he was tightly strapped to a chair surrounded by various dials. A person in a white coat was reading the dials. From outside came the sound of heavy footsteps; the door opened and a pale-faced officer entered with two guards behind him.
es_translation: He was tied to a chair surrounded by graduated spheres, under blinding spotlights. A man in a white coat was reading the disks. Outside, footsteps could be heard approaching. The door burst open. The wax-faced officer entered, followed by two guards.

en: “For certain purposes, of course, that is not true. When we navigate the ocean, or when we predict an eclipse, we often find it convenient to assume that the earth goes round the sun and that the stars are millions upon millions of kilometers away. But what of it? Do you suppose it is beyond us to produce a dual system of astronomy? The stars can be near or distant, according as we need them. Do you suppose our mathematicians are unequal to that? Have you forgotten doublethink?”
vi: “Đối với một số nhiệm vụ thì tất nhiên điều đó là sai. Khi lái tầu trên biển hoặc khi dự báo nhật, nguyệt thực thì chúng tôi coi trái đất quay xung quanh mặt trời và các vì sao nằm cách đây triệu triệu kilomet. Thế thì đã làm sao? Anh nghĩ rằng chúng tôi không thể tạo ra được môn thiên văn học kép à? Các vì sao ở gần hay ở xa là do nhu cầu của chúng tôi. Anh nghĩ rằng các nhà toán học của chúng tôi không kham nổi việc đó à? Anh đã quên nước đôi rồi sao?”
tr: "Bazı durumlarda bu elbette doğru değildir. Okyanus'a açıldığımızda ya da bir güneş tutulmasını önceden saptadığımızda, dünyanın güneş çevresinde döndüğünü ve yıldızların milyonlarca ışık yılı uzakta olduğunu varsaymak işimize gelir. Ama ne fark eder? İkili bir gökbilim sistemi yaratmanın olanaksız olduğunu mu sanıyorsun? Yıldızlar isteğimize göre, uzak ya da yakın olabilirler. Matematik bilgimizin yetersiz olduğunu düşünüyorsun. Çiftdüşünü unuttun mu?
es: —Desde luego, para ciertos fines es eso verdad. Cuando navegamos por el océano o cuando predecimos un eclipse, nos puede resultar conveniente dar por cierto que la Tierra gira alrededor del sol y que las estrellas se encuentran a millones y millones de kilómetros de nosotros. Pero, ¿qué importa eso? ¿Crees que está fuera de nuestros medios un sistema dual de astronomía? Las estrellas pueden estar cerca o lejos según las necesitemos. ¿Crees que ésa es tarea difícil para nuestros matemáticos? ¿Has olvidado el doblepensar?
vi_translation: “For some tasks, of course, that is wrong. When navigating a ship at sea or predicting solar and lunar eclipses, we consider the Earth to revolve around the sun and the stars to be millions of kilometers away. So what? Do you think we cannot create a dual astronomy? The stars being near or far depends on our needs. Do you think our mathematicians cannot handle that? Have you forgotten about duality?”
tr_translation: "In some cases, this is certainly not true. When we set sail on the ocean or predict a solar eclipse in advance, it suits us to assume that the world revolves around the sun and that the stars are millions of light-years away. But what difference does it make? Do you think it is impossible to create a dual astronomical system? The stars can be near or far according to our desire. Do you think our mathematical knowledge is insufficient? Have you forgotten doublethink?"
es_translation: —Of course, for certain purposes that is true. When we sail the ocean or when we predict an eclipse, it may be convenient for us to assume that the Earth revolves around the sun and that the stars are millions and millions of kilometers away from us. But, what does that matter? Do you think a dual system of astronomy is beyond our means? The stars can be near or far as we need them to be. Do you think that is a difficult task for our mathematicians? Have you forgotten doublethink?

en: He had no difficulty in disposing of the fallacy, and he was in no danger of succumbing to it. He realized, nevertheless, that it ought never to have occurred to him. The mind should develop a blind spot whenever a dangerous thought presented itself. The process should be automatic, instinctive. Crimestop, they called it in Newspeak.
vi: Anh dễ dàng phát hiện được sai lầm, nhưng khả năng mắc sai lầm là không có. Nhưng anh cũng hiểu rằng anh không được để cho những ý nghĩ như thế xuất hiện trong đầu nữa. Một ý nghĩ nguy hiểm vừa lởn vởn là trong đầu phải xuất hiện điểm mù ngay lập tức. Quá trình này phải là tự động, mang tính bản năng. Ngômo gọi đấy là ngưngtội.
tr: Hileyi açığa çıkarmakta bir güçlük çıkmıyordu ve olayı benimseme tehlikesi yoktu. Yine de hileyi hiç düşünmemiş olması gerekirdi. İnsanın aklı, tehlikeli bir düşünce ortaya çıktığı anda kör bir nokta oluşturmalıydı. Bu işlem, otomatik, içgüdüsel olmalıydı. Yenikonuşta buna suçdurdurma deniyordu.
es: No tuvo dificultad para eliminar estos engañosos pensamientos; no se vio en verdadero peligro de sucumbir a ellos. Sin embargo, pensó que nunca debían habérsele ocurrido. Su cerebro debía lanzar una mancha que tapara cualquier pensamiento peligroso al menor intento de asomarse a la conciencia. Este proceso había de ser automático, instintivo. En neolengua se le llamaba paracrimen.
vi_translation: He easily detects mistakes, but the possibility of making mistakes does not exist. However, he also understands that he must not let such thoughts appear in his mind anymore. A dangerous thought just flickered, and a blind spot must immediately appear in his mind. This process must be automatic, instinctive. Ngomo calls this "error cessation."
tr_translation: There was no difficulty in exposing the deceit and no danger of adopting the event. Still, he should never have considered the deceit. The human mind should create a blind spot the moment a dangerous thought arises. This process should be automatic, instinctive. In Newspeak, this was called crimethink.
es_translation: He had no difficulty eliminating these deceptive thoughts; he was not in real danger of succumbing to them. However, he thought that they should never have occurred to him. His brain should cast a stain that would cover any dangerous thought at the slightest attempt to surface in consciousness. This process had to be automatic, instinctive. In Newspeak, it was called crimestop.

en: For a moment he had had an overwhelming hallucination of her presence. She had seemed to be not merely with him, but inside him. It was as though she had got into the texture of his skin. In that moment he had loved her far more than he had ever done when they were together and free. Also he knew that somewhere or other she was still alive and needed his help.
vi: Anh có cảm tưởng như cô đang hiện diện đâu đây. Không phải bên cạnh mà là bên trong anh. Dường như cô đã trở thành một phần cơ thể anh. Trong giây phút đó anh cảm thấy yêu cô nhiều hơn khi họ còn bên nhau, ngoài tự do. Anh biết rằng cô đang còn sống ở đâu đó và đang rất cần anh giúp đỡ.
tr: Bir an için, onun varlığıyla dolup taşmıştı. Onu yalnız yanında değil, içindeymiş gibi hissetti. Julia teninin dokusuna işle- misti sanki. Julia'ya karşı o anda, birlikte ve özgür oldukları zamankinden çok daha fazla sevgi duymuştu. Onun yaşadığını ve yardıma gereksinimi olduğunu da hissetmişti.
es: Durante un momento había tenido una impresionante alucinación de su presencia. No sólo parecía que Julia estaba con él, sino dentro de él. Era como si la joven tuviera su misma piel. En aquel momento la había querido más que nunca. Además, sabía que se encontraba viva y necesitaba de su ayuda.
vi_translation: I have the feeling that she is present somewhere here. Not beside me, but inside me. It seems like she has become a part of my body. In that moment, I felt I loved her more than when we were together, outside of freedom. I know that she is still alive somewhere and desperately needs my help.
tr_translation: For a moment, he was overflowing with her presence. He felt her not just beside him, but as if she were inside him. Julia had permeated the texture of his skin- He felt as if he were dreaming. At that moment, he felt much more love for Julia than he had when they were together and free. He also sensed that she was alive and in need of help.
es_translation: For a moment he had had an impressive hallucination of her presence. It not only seemed that Julia was with him, but inside him. It was as if the young woman had his same skin. At that moment he had loved her more than ever. Moreover, he knew that she was alive and needed his help.

en: One day they would decide to shoot him. You could not tell when it would happen, but a few seconds beforehand it should be possible to guess. It was always from behind, walking down a corridor. Ten seconds would be enough. In that time the world inside him could turn over. And then suddenly, without a word uttered, without a check in his step, without the changing of a line in his face—suddenly the camouflage would be down and bang! would go the batteries of his hatred. Hatred would fill him like an enormous roaring flame. And almost in the same instant bang! would go the bullet, too late, or too early. They would have blown his brain to pieces before they could reclaim it. The heretical thought would be unpunished, unrepented, out of their reach forever. They would have blown a hole in their own perfection. To die hating them, that was freedom.
vi: Một ngày nào đó họ sẽ bắn anh. Không thể nói là khi nào, nhưng trước đó vài giây thì chắc là có thể đoán được. Luôn luôn từ phía sau, khi đang đi trong hành lang. Mười giây cũng đủ. Trong thời gian đó tâm hồn anh có thể kịp thay đổi hoàn toàn. Và thế là bất thình lình, không nói một lời nào, chân vẫn bước đều, nét mặt không hề thay đổi, anh xé tung cái mặt nạ ra, đoàng! loạt súng căm hận của anh đồng loạt lên tiếng. Lòng hận thù sẽ choán hết tâm hồn anh, như ngọn lửa đang bừng bừng gào thét. Và đúng lúc đó: đoàng! viên đạn bay ra, quá chậm hoặc là quá sớm. Họ sẽ bắn vỡ óc anh trước khi kịp cải tạo nó. Tư tưởng không chính thống chưa bị khuất phục, không hề sám hối đã vĩnh viễn vượt khỏi tầm với của họ. Lí tưởng của họ đã bị bắn thủng một lỗ. Chết mà vẫn căm thù - đấy chính là tự do.
tr: Günün birinde onu öldürmeye karar vereceklerdi. Ne zaman olacağını söyleyemezdi, ama olmadan birkaç saniye önce bilebilirdi. Her zaman koridorda yürürken arkadan vururlardı. On saniye yeterliydi. O zaman, içindeki dünya yüzeye çıkacaktı ve sonra bir anda tek söz söylemeden, adımlarında bir farklılık, yüzünün anlatımında bir değişiklik olmadan, birden o örtü kalkacak ve nefreti şiddetle dışarı vuracaktı. Nefret onu güçlü bir alev gibi dolduracaktı. İşte o anda kurşun da patlayacaktı! Kurşun ya çok erken ya da çok geç bulacaktı onu, aklını yeniden denetleyebilmelerinden çok önce, beynini parçalamış olacaklardı. Yoldan sapmış düşünce, cezalandırılmadan kalacak, sonsuza dek ellerinden kaçmış olacaktı. Yetkinliklerinde bir delilik açılacaktı. Onlardan nefret ederek ölmek; işte özgürlük buydu.
es: Algún día decidirían matarlo. Era imposible saber cuándo ocurriría, pero unos segundos antes podría adivinarse. Siempre lo mataban a uno por la espalda mientras andaba por un pasillo. Pero le bastarían diez segundos. Y entonces, de repente, sin decir una palabra, sin que se notara en los pasos que aún diera, sin alterar el gesto... podría tirar el camuflaje, y ¡bang!, soltar las baterías de su odio. Sí, en esos segundos anteriores a su muerte, todo su ser se convertiría en una enorme llamarada de odio. Y casi en el mismo instante ¡bang!, llegaría la bala, demasiado tarde, o quizá demasiado pronto. Le habrían destrozado el cerebro antes de que pudieran considerarlo de ellos. El pensamiento herético quedaría impune. No se habría arrepentido, quedaría para siempre fuera del alcance de esa gente. Con el tiro habrían abierto un agujero en esa perfección de que se vanagloriaban. Morir odiándolos, ésa era la libertad.
vi_translation: One day they will shoot you. It can't be said when, but a few seconds before it happens, it can probably be guessed. Always from behind, while walking in the hallway. Ten seconds is enough. In that time, your soul can completely change. And then suddenly, without saying a word, still walking steadily, with an unchanged expression, you tear off the mask, bang! your volley of hatred rings out. Hatred will fill your soul, like a blazing, roaring fire. And at that moment: bang! the bullet flies out, too late or too early. They will blow your brains out before they can reform it. Unorthodox thoughts, not yet subdued, unrepentant, will forever be beyond their reach. Their ideals will have a hole shot through them. To die still hating - that is freedom.
tr_translation: One day, they would decide to kill him. He couldn't say when it would happen, but he could know a few seconds before it did. They always shot him from behind while he was walking down the corridor. Ten seconds were enough. Then, the world inside him would surface, and then suddenly, without saying a single word, without any difference in his steps, without any change in the expression on his face, that veil would lift, and his hatred would violently burst out. Hatred made him strong would fill like a flame. And at that moment, the bullet would fire! The bullet would either find him too early or too late, before they could regain control of his mind, they would have shattered his brain. The stray thought would remain unpunished, it would have escaped their grasp forever. A madness would open in their perfection. To die hating them; that was freedom.
es_translation: Someday they would decide to kill him. It was impossible to know when it would happen, but a few seconds before it could be guessed. They always killed someone from behind while walking down a hallway. But ten seconds would be enough for him. And then, suddenly, without saying a word, without it being noticeable in the steps he still took, without altering his expression... he could drop the camouflage, and bang!, unleash the batteries of his hatred. Yes, in those seconds before his death, his entire being would become an enormous flame of hatred. And almost at the same instant, bang!, the bullet would arrive, too late, or perhaps too soon. They would have destroyed his brain before they could consider it theirs. The heretical thought would remain unpunished. He would not have repented, he would remain forever out of reach of those people. With the shot they would have opened a hole in that perfection they boasted about. To die hating them, that was freedom.

en: The spasm passed. He put the white knight back in its place, but for the moment he could not settle down to serious study of the chess problem. His thoughts wandered again. Almost unconsciously he traced with his finger in the dust on the table:
vi: Cơn xúc động rồi cũng qua. Anh đặt con mã trở lại vị trí cũ, nhưng không tập trung vào ván cờ được. Ý nghĩ cứ lang thang ở tận đâu đâu. Anh lấy ngón tay vẽ trên mặt bàn bụi một cách vô thức:
tr: Spazm geçti. Beyaz atı eski yerine koydu. Bir süre bu ciddi satranç oyununa kendisini veremedi. Düşünceleri yeniden dolaşmaya başladı. Bilinçsiz bir biçimde, parmağını masanın tozları üzerinde gezdirdi ve;
es: Le pasó aquel sobresalto. Volvió a poner la pieza en su sitio, pero por un instante no pudo concentrarse en el problema de ajedrez. Sus pensamientos volvieron a vagar. Casi conscientemente trazó con su dedo en el polvo de la mesa:
vi_translation: The emotional surge eventually passed. He placed the knight back to its original position, but couldn't focus on the game. His thoughts wandered far away. He absentmindedly drew on the dusty table with his finger:
tr_translation: The spasm passed. He put the white horse back in its old place. For a while, he couldn't immerse himself in this serious chess game. His thoughts began to wander again. Unconsciously, he ran his finger over the dust on the table and;
es_translation: That jolt happened to him. He put the piece back in its place, but for a moment he couldn't concentrate on the chess problem. His thoughts began to wander again. Almost consciously, he traced with his finger in the dust on the table:

en: A shrill trumpet call had pierced the air. It was the bulletin! Victory! It always meant victory when a trumpet call preceded the news. A sort of electric thrill ran through the café. Even the waiters had started and pricked up their ears.
vi: Tiếng kèn đồng bỗng gầm lên, như muốn xé toạc bầu không khí. Bản tin! Chiến thắng rồi! Kèn đồng thổi trước khi đưa tin là chiến thắng. Như có một luồng điện truyền khắp quán. Ngay cả các hầu bàn cũng nhảy lên và dỏng ra tai nghe.
tr: Tiz bir borazan sesi yardı havayı. Bültendi bu! Zafer! Haberlerden önce borazan çalması zafer olduğuna işaretti. Kahvede bir tür elektriklenme oldu. Garsonlar bile kulak kabarttılar.
es: Un agudo trompetazo perforó el aire: Era el comunicado, ¡victoria!; siempre significaba victoria la llamada de la trompeta antes de las noticias. Una especie de corriente eléctrica recorrió a todos los que se hallaban en el café. Hasta los camareros se sobresaltaron y aguzaron el oído.
vi_translation: The brass trumpet suddenly roared, as if it wanted to tear the atmosphere apart. News flash! Victory! The brass trumpet blows before announcing the victory. It was as if an electric current ran through the entire establishment. Even the waiters jumped up and pricked up their ears to listen.
tr_translation: A shrill trumpet sound pierced the air. This was an announcement! Victory! The trumpet sounding before the news was a sign of victory. There was a kind of excitement in the coffeehouse. Even the waiters pricked up their ears.
es_translation: A sharp trumpet blast pierced the air: It was the announcement, victory!; the trumpet call always meant victory before the news. A kind of electric current ran through everyone in the café. Even the waiters were startled and perked up their ears.
